name: "Sly Cooper" - Spell It Out (PS2) Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text:
For this quiz, I will give you a question, and four answers to choose from.  Pick the right answer, and for the tenth question, put all the first letters of each answer down to spell the name of a character.

Which of the following places has the Sly Cooper gang never gone to in any of the games in the trilogy?
questions.explanation:
Jerusalem.

	The gang has been to Paris the most often.  You go to Paris to fight Dimitri in the second game.  You go to Mesa City to fight Muggshott in the first game, and Bollywood to fight Rajan in the second game.  You have never gone to Jerusalem.

questions.text: What has been put in the water in the second Contessa level of the second game?
questions.explanation:
Eels.

	Eels have been put in the water to prevent intruders from breaking in.  In this level, Constable Neyla and Contessa get into a war, and you must try to stop them AND get to the Clockwerk eyes.  The eels are electric eels, so you will die when you hit the water, instead of just taking damage like normal.

questions.text: Which of these are Clockwerk parts you don't collect?
questions.explanation:
All of these.

	You never collect the beak, ears, or brain of Clockwerk.  Throughout the game, you collect many other Clockwerk parts, like the eyes, lungs, heart, and wings.  The Contessa holds the eyes, Jean Bison holds the lungs and the stomach, and Rajan has the heart and wings.

questions.text: What is the name of Carmelita's partner in crime in the second game?
questions.explanation:
Neyla.

	Constable Neyla is Inspector Carmelita's partner in crime.  Neyla turns on Carmelita and works with Sly and the gang, and turns on them to work with Carmelita again, but is against Carmelita AND Sly and the gang to become Clockwerk herself.  She named herself Clockla.

questions.text: Which of the following characters is one of Sly's best friends, and is the brains of all heists and missions?
questions.explanation:
Bentley.

	You do not get Penelope and Guru until the third game.  Bentley and Murray are lifelong friends of yours.  Bentley, the brains, was injured in the second game, and Murray blames himself for what happened.  He leaves the team in the third game, so you must get him back.  Bentley is confined to a wheelchair in the third game, and he has rigged it to pickpocket, triple jump, accelerate, and throw bombs.  He is not only the brains but also the demolitions expert.

questions.text: Which of the following is Carmelita considered?
questions.explanation:
Inspector.

	Inspector Carmelita Fox is Sly's main enemy, although Sly has a huge crush on her.  Inspector Fox does get a Constable during the second game, Neyla.  She also has Lieutenants throughout the game, but is never considered one herself.

questions.text: During the third game, a coffee shop guards wants to be buried in something.  What is it?
questions.explanation:
Sauce.

	The guard claims that his mom's pasta sauce is so good, he wants to be buried in it.  Sly can't get it out of his mind.  He can't see how pasta sauce could be so good.  He keeps bugging Bentley about stopping for a bite to eat to see what the big deal is about Italian sauce.

questions.text: Which of the following colors is NOT on Sly Cooper's outfit?
questions.explanation:
Orange.

	Sly always wears his blue outfit, with yellow strips and some red as well.  However, he does change his outfit to disguise himself.  He was become a photographer in a purple suit, and also a 'guard' in Venice.  He has also become punk to disguise himself during a trip.

questions.text: Has the Guru ever spoken any words?
questions.explanation:
No.

	The Guru never says anything, but just makes a lot of babbling noises.  The gang understands what he says, but we never get words on the screen so we can see what he is saying.  The Guru is a purple koala from Australia who specialized in "Dream Time."

questions.text: Now take the first letter of each of the first nine answers to spell out the name of a character from "Sly 2".  What is the correct answer?
questions.explanation:
Jean Bison.

	Jean Bison is a buffalo from Canada.  He was frozen for several hundred years, and was thawed out to our day.  He has stolen some Clockwerk parts, which run his "Iron Horses", or his trains.
